titleStmt.title: By the King Charles by the grace of God, King of England, Scotland, France, and Ireland, defender of the faith, &c. to all to whome these presents shall come, greeting : whereas wee haue receiued certaine information ... of the most lamentable state of the poore exiled ministers of the Palatinate ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Arms with initials "C R" at top, leaves under lion's leg.
for 2 year collections on behalf of exiled ministers of the Palatinate.
"Witnesse Our Selfe at Westminster, the sixth day of March, in the fift [sic] yeere of Our Reigne."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.

person.persName: Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie
